net.viktorc.detroid.util

Class BitOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.detroid.util.BitOperations

  • public final class BitOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    A static class exclusively for bitwise operations. Some of them are implemented in the Java API, but to have a clear idea about the costs and to understand the logic, they are re-implemented and provided here.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Method Detail

      • indexOfBit

        public static byte indexOfBit(long n)
        Returns the index of the single bit set in the input variable. It is assumed that the input parameter has only one set bit and it is not checked!
        Parameters:
        n - The number with a single set bit.
        Returns:
        The index of that bit.

      • getMSBit

        public static long getMSBit(long n)
        Returns the most significant (leftmost) bit in a long.
        Parameters:
        n - The number.
        Returns:
        The value of the leftmost set bit.

      • resetMSBit

        public static long resetMSBit(long n)
        Returns a long with the most significant (leftmost) bit in the input parameter reset.
        Parameters:
        n - The number.
        Returns:
        The number with the leftmost set bit reset.

      • serialize

        public static byte[] serialize(long n)
        Returns an array of the indexes of all set bits in the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        n - The number.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes representing the indexes of all the set bits in the number.

      • getAllSubsets

        public static long[] getAllSubsets(long n)
        Returns an array of all the bitwise subsets of the parameter number.
        Parameters:
        n - The number.
        Returns:
        An array of the numbers made up by all the bitwise subsets of the number.

      • toBinaryString

        public static java.lang.String toBinaryString(long n)
        Returns a string representation of a long in binary form with all the 64 bits displayed whether set or not.
        Parameters:
        n - The number.
        Returns:
        A string representation with all leading zeros included.

      • toBinaryLiteral

        public static java.lang.String toBinaryLiteral(long n)

        Returns:
